interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/03/18
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vince Gilligan', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Peter Gould', 'Michael Morris', 'Adam Bernstein', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Colin Bucksey', 'John Shiban', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Terry McDonough'], 'Producers': ['Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould'], 'Studio': ['American Movie Classics (AMC)']}
Review Text: Better Call Saul was a great show, beginning in the first episode, and I don't think it's all due to the fact that we knew some of the characters. The actors are wonderful, the script is fabulous, and the directing is first rate. Even my husband, who thought Breaking Bad was too dark, already loves this show. What is so impressive about it (and its predecessor) is the depth of character portrayal. You see the characters' struggles with "right" vs."wrong," you see the shadows as much as you see the sunlight. It's a great show.
Review Title: No surprise how good this show is
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
